intro: Allium dinsmorei, commonly known as the Dinsmore's onion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces a single, upright stem bearing a cluster of small, white or pale purple flowers. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a bulbous base that stores nutrients. Allium dinsmorei is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments.
